definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: Seal is divided into Dazhuan and Xiaozhuan, is a Chinese book-an important stage.
sentences.chinese: 篆书又分为大篆和小篆，是汉字书体发的主要阶段。

sentences.english: Following the gradual prospering of seal script and clerical script, calligraphic wind of stele school matured as well.
sentences.chinese: 而随着篆隶书体的逐步繁荣，碑派书风亦走向成熟。

sentences.english: The change brought about a calligraphic revolution that led to the birth of calligraphy as an art form.
sentences.chinese: 这一变化引发了一场书体革命，诞生了书法艺术。

sentences.english: But the occurrence of the calligraphy style is also the inevitable result which the font continues to evolve.
sentences.chinese: 而书体的发生又是书风持续衍变的必然结果。

sentences.english: The need of people is the real reason for calligraphical evolution.
sentences.chinese: 人的需要是书体演变的内在原因。

definition: the great seal/used narrowly for 籀文/used broadly for many pre-Qin scripts
seal script as unified by the Qin dynasty/the small seal 小篆 and great seal 大篆
early form of Chinese characters inscribed in stone, a precursor of the small seal 小篆[xiao3 zhuan4]
a rubbing from a stone inscription
seal (of office)/seal script (a calligraphic style)/the small seal 小篆 and great seal 大篆/writing in seal script
